Lenin on Political Revolution

"Summing up Stalin's life and activity as a fighter against tsarism, against capitalism and its agents, for Marxism-Leninism, for socialism and communism, for the victory of the October Revolution, the Soviet state, for the construction of socialism in the USSR, for the defeat of the fascist invaders in the Patriotic War, we must first of all not repeat imperialist slanderous fabrications.

 But in the revolutionary, scientific, Party-like, Leninist way of evaluating the positive and negative, not to allow petty-bourgeois sensationalism, overblowing and substituting mistakes and shortcomings of everything historically great that Stalin has done for the Party, the people and the country." 

February, 1990.

On March 5, 1953, Joseph Vissarionovich Stalin, revolutionary Bolshevik, one of the greatest theorists of Marxism, a disciple of Lenin, the leader of the Soviet state, the leader of the CPSU, passed away.

On the occasion of this date, we want to recall the words of an excellent Soviet statesman, an economic and party figure, who defended the honorable name of Stalin up to his death – Lazar Kaganovich.

#History #USSR 
The first computer-made cartoon was created in USSR. And it was about cats.

In 1968 a group of soviet physicians and mathematicians created a mathematical model for the motion of a cat ("Koshyechka" on russian). They wrote a program for the soviet BESM-4 computer. 

BESM-4 printed hundreds of frames on paper using alphabet symbols that were latter filmed in sequence thus creating the first computer animation of a character: a walking cat.

On February 26, 1869, Lenin's wife, Nadezhda Krupskaya was born. She was a revolutionary, made a great contribution defeating illiteracy in Russia and building the system of modern education in the Soviet Union.

#Date #History #Quotes 
On the same day, in 1903, Julius Fučík, a Czechoslovak journalist and writer, and a member of the Communist Party of Czechoslovakia, was born. 

Fučík was a literary and theatrical critic, a publicist, and an underground anti-fascist during World War II. His most famous book, "Notes from the Gallows", was written in a Nazi prison. It was written on pieces of cigarette paper and smuggled out by sympathetic prison warders.

In 1918, during the Russian Civil War, “Socialist Homeland is in Danger!” decree was published, calling for the first mass draft into the Red Army. This day became known as “Red Army Day”.

As in the case of May 9, Russian capitalists obscured the true essence of Red Army Day, replacing it with patriotic calls to “defend the fatherland”, i.e. to maintain the existing order, which oligarchs profit from. But what kind of extra-class “fatherland” can we talk about under the rule of capitalism with its monstrous social inequality and exploitation?

Rejecting the lies of the capitalists, one thing is clear – for the majority of the people it will be possible to speak about real “defense of the Fatherland” only after the establishment of the rule of the working class and the emergence of a new socialist state.

"This little booklet is worth whole volumes: to this day its spirit inspires and guides the entire organised and fighting proletariat of the civilised world". (Vladimir Lenin - "Friedrich Engels")

We highly recommend you to read this book.

#Theory #Trotskyism
Explaining Trotskyism, its historical development and its main features that do damage to the communist movement in our article (translation from Greek).
"...The need for this analysis is due to the following factors:

Firstly, the capitalist system actively uses Trotsky’s image, making ahistorical attacks on Lenin and Stalin, and questioning the construction of socialism in the USSR. On the 89th anniversary of the October Revolution, the struggle over Trotsky’s statements on the alleged impossibility of the victory of socialism in Russia is gaining momentum.

Secondly, a number of organizations both in our country and abroad, calling themselves Trotskyists or using Trotskyist theory, are increasing their efforts amongst the youth, especially in schools and universities, as well as among the working class. These groups are too small to be a threat in the communist movement, but under the guise of “revolutionarism” they reproduce bourgeois and opportunist views..."

#History
"What are the Soviets?" In despite of the conviction of many comrades, they are not necessarily “Councils of Workshop Delegates” to give as nearly exact a title as possible. What they are, and what distinguishes them from every other body of men in history —including even “Councils of Workshop Delegates” in non-revolutionary periods — is: the central fighting organiяations of the struggling proletariat during the period of revolution; first assuming the most elementary, then winning one by one the remaining functions of the State organisation of the capitalist class; and finally emerging from the struggle as the State organisation of the victorious proletariat during the Period of Communist reconstruction."
– What Are Soviets? by W. E. Harding.  The Communist Review, May 1921, Vol. 1, No. 1.

#quote #USSR #Lenin

Lenin on Peaceful Assumption of Power

The working class would, of course, prefer to take power peacefully (we have already stated that this seizure of power can be carried out only by the organized working class which has passed through the school of the class struggle), but to renounce the revolutionary seizure of power would be madness on the part of the proletariat, both from the theoretical and the practical-political points of view; it would mean nothing but a disgraceful retreat in face of the bourgeoisie and all other propertied classes.

Vladimir Lenin, A Retrograde Trend in Russian Social-Democracy

#quotes  
"Under Socialism, you would not be allowed to be poor. You would be forcibly fed, clothed, lodged, taught, and employed whether you liked it or not. If it were discovered that you had not character and industry enough to be worth all this trouble, you might possibly be executed in a kindly manner; but whilst you were permitted to live, you would have to live well."

George Bernard Shaw

#quote #USSR #Lenin

The proletariat should not ignore peaceful methods of struggle—they serve its ordinary, day-to-day interests, they are necessary in periods of preparation for revolution—but it must never forget that in certain conditions the class struggle assumes the form of armed conflict and civil war; there are times when the interests of the proletariat call for ruthless extermination of its enemies in open armed clashes. 

Vladimir Lenin, Lessons of the Commune

#quote #Engels

The law is sacred to the bourgeois, for it is his own composition, enacted with his consent, and for his benefit and protection. He knows that, even if an individual law should injure him, the whole fabric protects his interests; and more than all, the sanctity of the law, the sacredness of order as established by the active will of one part of society, and the passive acceptance of the other, is the strongest support of his social position.

Friedrich Engels, Condition of the Working Class in England

#quote #USSR #Lenin

Lenin on Workers’ Organization

In its struggle for power the proletariat has no other weapon but organization. Disunited by the rule of anarchic competition in the bourgeois world, ground down by forced labor for capital, constantly thrust back to the “lower depths” of utter destitution, savagery, and degeneration, the proletariat can, and inevitably will, become an invincible force only through its ideological unification on the principles of Marxism being reinforced by the material unity of organization, which welds millions of toilers into an army of the working class.

Vladimir Lenin, One Step Forward, Two Steps Back

#History  #USA  #quotes 
"The goal of the Socialist Party is Socialism, not a reformed capitalism. Its tactics must be those that will bring about Socialism. 

If those who are advocating reversion can show that these proposals will help to establish Socialism, and are not merely personal views and predilections in regard to the war, which have no relation to a Socialist policy, then the party should be ready to listen to them.

 If they can not show that then their advice deserves no consideration. To prove that Socialism will be attained, not by a working class movement ﬁghting a class struggle for the reorganization of our industrial system, but through an alliance with the enemy we are ﬁghting, that is the impossible task before those who are urging the party to change its position."

"Where do We Stand?" (1918)

C. E. Ruthenberg - Marxist politician and a founder and head of the American Communist Party

In connection with this date, it is worth recalling the crimes of the Kolchak army.

1918-December 25-26: Massacre of several hundred socialist militants and workers imprisoned at Omsk by units of General I.N. Krasilnikov (Admiral Kolchak's Army), 1919 Mid-April: Massacre of 670 prisoners (militant Socialist-Revolutionaries, workers) incarcerated in Ufa, 1919-May: Massacre of 350 prisoners incarcerated in Chita, 1919- July 10-14: Pogrom in Yekaterinburg. Approximately 2,200 victims, mostly Jewish.

It is worth recalling that Kolchak's close ties with the United Kingdom and the United States are well documented. 

Historians with impeccably objective credentials point to Kolchak's contacts with foreign interests. As the historian Oleg Budnitsky notes, the fact that Kolchak became the leader of the anti-Bolshevik movement in Siberia is not accidental. "Without a doubt, the fact that he was well-known, relatively well-known to political figures in the United Kingdom and the United States, played a huge role." 

This was the first major victory over the capitalist reaction. This proved that even bestial cruelty will not help the doomed ruling class to subdue the people who have raised their heads.

#quotes #USA
"Bolshevism is not something strange and new. It is not a blind, raging force of destruction. If at present its triumph is accompanied by bloodshed and destruction it is because the bankruptcy of capitalism precipitated a cataclysm and the workers are obliged to build the new order amidst the wreckage of the old and with those who proﬁted from their former oppression and exploitation placing every obstacle possible in their path. Bolshevism is Marxian Socialism in action. It is the social revolution underway. It is the workers on the road to victory and a better world."
 
"The Bolshevists: Grave-Diggers of Capitalism" (1919) – C. E. Ruthenberg (american Marxist  politician and a founder and head of the Communist party of USA).

#USSR #History #Agitation.

"They have abundance only for the rich, while we strive for abundance for all. 
About 20 million Americans can't afford to buy more then 1 liter of milk in a month and to consume more then 6 kilograms of meat in a year"
Soviet agitation poster by V. Govorkov, 1957

The Yalta Conference of 1945, a conference of the heads of government of the three powers allied in the Second World War of 1939-1945-the USSR, the USA, Great Britain: Chairman of the SNK of the USSR I. V. Stalin, US President F. D. Roosevelt and British Prime Minister W. Churchill with the participation of foreign ministers, chiefs of staff, etc. the advisors. 

It took place in Yalta on February 4-11, at a time when, as a result of the powerful offensive attacks of the Soviet Army, which transferred military operations to German territory, the war against Hitler's Germany entered the final stage. The war plans of the Powers for the final defeat of fascist Germany were agreed upon, their attitude towards Germany after its unconditional surrender was determined, and the basic principles of the general policy towards the post-war organization of the world were outlined. 

It was decided that after the German armed resistance was finally crushed, the armed forces of the USSR, the United States and Great Britain would occupy Germany; and the troops of each of the mentioned powers would occupy a certain part (zone) of Germany. It also provided for the creation of a coordinated allied administration in Germany and the establishment of control, carried out through a specially created control body consisting of the commanders-in-chief of the three powers, with the seat in Berlin. At the same time, it was indicated that France would be invited to take over a certain zone of occupation and participate as the fourth member of this control body. 

The specific resolution of the issue of occupation zones of Germany was achieved before the K. K. in the European Advisory Commission and recorded in the Protocol of the Agreement between the governments of the USSR, USA and the United Kingdom occupation zones of Germany and about the management of 'Big Berlin''dated September 12, 1944. The participants of the conference stated that their unwavering goal is to destroy German militarism and Nazism and to create guarantees that ' Germany will never again be able to violate

#history
February 4, 1945 76 years ago 
The Crimean (Yalta) Conference has begun

And from under the ceiling
screeches 
a rabid canary.
Marx was looking and looking from the wall...
But suddenly
stretched his mouth,
and yelled:
"Suburbanity's threads entangled the revolution.
Scarier then Wrangel is philistine life.
Hurry
break canaries' heads –
so that communism
wouldn't be broken by them!"
The photo: Vladimir Mayakovsky with his posters.

#history #USSR
The "Soviet-styled" patterns look really interesting even nowadays. However, in 1920s not all the people accepted the textile with the sickle and hammer – main symbols of the Soviet Union. A lot of communists viewed these things as mockery of their ideals: they fought to the death for these sacred symbols, while someone wears them as the part of the dress. "On Rubbish" poem, written by the famous Soviet poet Vladimir Mayakovsky, is the perfect example:
...And in the evening
this or that scum,
is looking.
At his wife,
studying the piano, and 
says,
chilling with samovar:
"Comrade Nadya!
Increase for the holiday –
24 thousand rubles.
Tariff.
Well, I'll buy myself
Pacific-Oceaned breeches,
to look from 
the trousers
as coral reef!"
And Nadya:
"Dresses with emblems for me.
Without sickle and hammer you can't go out!
What
will I wear
today
on the dancing-party in the Revvoyensoviet?!"
Marx' portrait on the wall.
The frame is red.
Lying on "Izvestiya", a kitten warms up.

#quote #USSR #Stalin
Stalin on Bourgeois Constitutions

Bourgeois constitutions tacitly proceed from the premise that society consists of antagonistic classes, of classes which own wealth and classes which do not own wealth; that no matter what party comes into power, the guidance of society by the state (the dictatorship) must be in the hands of the bourgeoisie; that a constitution is needed for the purpose of consolidating a social order desired by, and beneficial to, the propertied classes.

Joseph Stalin,
On the Draft Constitution of the U.S.S.R

The American trusts are the supreme expression of the economics of imperialism or monopoly capitalism. They do not confine themselves to economic means of eliminating rivals, but constantly resort to political, even criminal, methods.

A Caricature of Marxism and Imperialist Economism

#quote #Lenin #theory
According to the theory of socialism, i.e., of Marxism (non Marxist socialism is not worth serious discussion nowadays), the real driving force of history is the revolutionary class struggle; reforms are a subsidiary product of this struggle, subsidiary because they express unsuccessful attempts to weaken, to blunt this struggle, etc. According to the theory of bourgeois philosophers, the driving force of progress is the unity of all elements in society who realise the “imperfections” of certain of its institutions. The first theory is materialist; the second is idealist. The first is revolutionary; the second is reformist. The first serves as the basis for the tactics of the proletariat in modern capitalist countries. The second serves as the basis of the tactics of the bourgeoisie.

Vladimir Lenin, Once Again About the Duma Cabinet

The social networks all across the globe are controlled by capitalists. They do what they want, and they want to remove any possibilities for communists to agitate people. We've created a Telegram channel, where you can get latest posts from Politsturm International. Class struggle news, Marxist-Leninist theory, history of the communist movement, useful facts and statistics – you can find all of these here. Join our channel and discuss our posts with comrades across the world!

#quote #Lenin #theory
Disarmament is the ideal of socialism. There will be no wars in socialist society; consequently, disarmament will be achieved But whoever expects that socialism will be achieved without a social revolution and the dictatorship of the proletariat is not a socialist.

Vladimir Lenin, The “Disarmament” Slogan

Hello! This is Politsturm International channel. Politsturm is a Marxist-Leninist project aimed at reestablishing communist movement across the world. Class struggle news, history of the communist movement, the Soviet Union, the world socialist system, etc. – we produce a lot of content.
